A street merchant inexplicably gives you a small discount on your next purchase.
You find a coin in your boot that wasn't there before. It's warm to the touch.
A stray cat follows you for the rest of the day and hisses at anyone who lies to you.
The next lock you encounter is slightly rusted in your favor.
A dead ancestor whispers a single useful word in your sleep tonight.
A bird drops a small, shiny key at your feet. It fits something nearby.
Your weapon gleams with a faint light the next time you draw it. Purely cosmetic, but intimidating.
A travelling merchant owes you a favor they can't quite remember why.
The weather shifts subtly in your favor for the next outdoor encounter.
You wake up tomorrow feeling unusually well-rested. No reason. Just vibes.
A clockwork beetle crawls out of a crack in the wall and delivers a tiny, helpful note.
The next trap you encounter makes an audible click just before triggering.
A drunk oracle stumbles past you and mutters something surprisingly relevant.
Your rations taste inexplicably better today. Morale is high.
A minor spirit of curiosity decides to orbit your head for the next hour, illuminating dark corners.
The next rope you climb feels unusually sturdy and cooperative.
A stranger in a tavern buys you a drink and refuses to explain why.
Your armor feels lighter today. Not mechanically, just... lighter.
A raven lands on your shoulder and caws once in the direction of hidden danger.
You discover an extra healing potion wedged in the lining of your pack. How long has that been there?
The next person you try to persuade is in an uncommonly good mood.
A gentle tailwind follows you for the rest of the day.
Your campfire tonight burns cleaner, warmer, and requires less fuel.
A child hands you a crudely drawn map. One landmark on it is actually accurate.
The next door you open doesn't creak.
A butterfly lands on your weapon hand. Your next strike feels guided.
You overhear a conversation that contains one genuinely useful piece of information.
A cobblestone shifts underfoot, revealing a small hidden compartment beneath.
Your reflection in water winks at you. Nothing happens, but it's reassuring.
The next potion you drink tastes like your favorite childhood meal.
A gear-sprite has oiled your equipment overnight. Everything moves smoothly.
You find a four-leaf clover pressed inside a book. Someone left it there on purpose.
A passing cloud briefly shapes itself into an arrow pointing the right direction.
The next NPC you speak to happens to be in a talkative mood.
A small clockwork mouse delivers a copper piece to your bedroll. Its origin is unclear.
Your boots don't get muddy today, despite the terrain.
The stars tonight seem to form a pattern only you can read. It suggests patience.
A street performer's song gives you a sudden flash of insight about your current problem.
The next critical failure you witness happens to your enemy instead.
A tinkerer offers to adjust one of your items for free. Just a minor improvement.
You find a comfortable rock to sit on exactly when you need to rest.
A fox crosses your path three times today. The third time, it drops something small and useful.
The next lie told in your presence sounds just slightly off to your ears.
Your shadow moves independently for a moment and points at something you missed.
A bakery gives you a free pastry because you remind them of someone they liked.
The next pit you almost fall into has convenient handholds along the edge.
A songbird mimics a phrase you needed to hear. Pure coincidence, surely.
Your torch burns an extra hour longer than it should.
A grizzled veteran nods at you with genuine respect as you pass. You've never met them.
The wind carries a scent that reminds you exactly of home. You feel steadied.
A librarian remembers you from a visit you never made and offers you a restricted text.
Your next meal is cooked to absolute perfection by sheer accident.
A clockwork compass in a junk shop spins to point at you, then settles on true north.
The next secret door you search for has a slightly visible seam.
A temple acolyte blesses you in passing. It's minor, but genuine.
You find exactly the right amount of rope for your next task.
A harmless snake coils around your wrist briefly, then slithers toward a hidden path.
The merchant accidentally gives you too much change. They insist you keep it.
Your next Recall Knowledge check feels like remembering rather than guessing.
A breeze blows a wanted poster into your hand. The face on it is useful information.
The next ambush against you starts one round later than intended. Something delayed them.
A child's lost toy that you return earns you unexpected goodwill from an important NPC.
Your next night watch is unusually peaceful. The stars are beautiful.
A gear-driven music box plays a tune that matches your current mood perfectly.
The next poison you encounter smells faintly of almonds, giving you just enough warning.
An old coin you've been carrying turns out to be worth slightly more than expected.
A messenger raven meant for someone else lands on your arm. The message is... interesting.
Your spell component pouch seems slightly heavier today. Something extra is in there.
A dock worker offers to carry your heaviest item for free. No strings attached.
The next illusion you encounter has a faint shimmer at the edges.
A street urchin warns you about a shortcut that's actually legitimate.
Your next rest is undisturbed by dreams. You wake sharp and focused.
A blacksmith tests a blade on your armor and is impressed. Word spreads.
The tide of battle shifts. An enemy trips on something inconvenient.
A potted plant in the next building you enter has a small coin hidden in its soil.
The next magical aura you detect is slightly easier to identify than usual.
A stray dog leads you to a dropped pouch with a few silver pieces.
Your cloak catches the wind dramatically at a socially advantageous moment.
An alchemist gives you a free sample. It's not amazing, but it's not nothing.
The next bookshelf you search has its most useful tome at eye level.
A fortune teller refuses your payment and says you'll need the coin more than her.
Your weapon hits a nerve cluster by pure chance. The enemy flinches.
A mechanical songbird perched on a windowsill sings a melody that calms nearby tensions.
The next guard you encounter is at the end of their shift and doesn't care.
You discover your canteen has kept water colder than it should be. Refreshing.
A monastery bell rings as you pass, and a monk bows to you. Old tradition, they say.
The next wall you need to climb has surprisingly good handholds.
A jeweler identifies something in your possession as slightly more valuable than you thought.
An informant you've never paid suddenly feels chatty.
Your pack seems better organized than you left it. Nothing is missing.
The next forked path you encounter has faded footprints on the correct route.
A steamwork vent blasts warm air at you on a cold day. Perfect timing.
The next disguise you attempt works on someone it really shouldn't have.
A farmer offers you fresh produce for free. Harvest was good this year, they say.
Your next initiative feels faster. Something clicks into place.
A minor water elemental playfully splashes clean water on your face. You feel refreshed.
The next fence you need to jump has a convenient lower section.
A tattoo parlor offers you a free small design. It might be magical. It might not.
Your fire resistance seems slightly better today. Probably your imagination.
A courier delivers a package to the wrong address. Your address. The contents are mildly useful.
The next social encounter starts with the other party already slightly impressed by your reputation.
A temple's donation box spills a few coins in your direction. The priest waves it off.
Your next stealth check benefits from a conveniently timed loud noise nearby.
A cartographer has marked something interesting near your current location. Free of charge.
The next time you're lost, a carved trail marker appears that you're certain wasn't there before.
A bard dedicates a song to you in a tavern. Your reputation improves slightly in this district.
Your next crafting attempt yields slightly better results than expected.
A warehouse door that should be locked is slightly ajar when you arrive.
The next scroll you find is in a language you happen to read.
A soldier shares their field rations with you. Military grade. Not bad.
Your mount seems particularly energetic and sure-footed today.
A gemstone in a shop window catches the light and reveals a flaw. The price drops.
The floor in the next dungeon room is surprisingly clean. Something was here recently.
A herbalist identifies a plant near camp that has mild healing properties.
Your next Perception check catches something at the very edge of your awareness.
A fisherman's catch includes something that isn't a fish. Could be useful.
The next enchanted item you examine resonates faintly with your touch.
A traveling circus performer shows you a trick. It's actually applicable to lockpicking.
Your armor doesn't chafe today. Small mercies.
A gust of wind blows a relevant document off someone's desk and into the street.
The next time you take cover, the cover is slightly more substantial than it looked.
A dwarven merchant admires your gear and offers free maintenance.
Your next ranged attack benefits from an unexpected lull in the wind.
A ghost you can barely see gives you a thumbs up and fades away.
The next riddle or puzzle you encounter reminds you of one you solved as a child.
A clockwork toy in a shop window points at you, then at a nearby alley. Coincidence.
Your bedroll is inexplicably more comfortable tonight.
An enemy's weapon has a hairline crack you notice just before they swing.
A washwoman hanging laundry accidentally drops a clean cloak on you. She insists you keep it.
The next diplomatic encounter starts with an unexpected common interest.
Your rations include a spice packet you don't remember packing. Everything tastes better.
A minor earth tremor reveals the outline of something buried nearby.
The next wanted poster you see has outdated information that works in your favor.
A gnomish inventor gives you a gadget that does exactly one useful thing, once.
Your next Reflex save benefits from muscle memory you didn't know you had.
A ship's captain remembers you fondly from a voyage you barely recall. Free passage offered.
The last page of a torn journal lands at your feet. The contents are relevant.
A cat sleeping on a windowsill stretches and knocks a useful item off the ledge toward you.
The next magical trap you encounter fizzles slightly before activating. You get a warning.
A retired adventurer in a tavern buys a round and shares one actually useful piece of advice.
Your healing feels slightly more effective today. Warm hands.
A street sweeper reveals a storm drain that leads somewhere interesting.
The lock on your room at the inn is surprisingly good. Best sleep in weeks.
A merchant's wagon breaks down near you. Helping them earns genuine, useful gratitude.
Your next Fortitude save is bolstered by a stubborn refusal to be inconvenienced.
A pigeon delivers a message clearly meant for someone else. The contents are intriguing.
The next darkness you enter has a faint phosphorescent moss you can almost navigate by.
A hawk circles above you three times, then dives at something hidden in the grass ahead.
A spider spins a web across a doorway you were about to walk through. The room beyond has a different exit.
A horse at a stable nuzzles your hand. The stablemaster says it never does that.
Fireflies spell out a word in the darkness. You catch only half of it, but it's enough.
A wolf howls in the distance at exactly the right moment to cover a noise you made.
A frog sitting on a milestone croaks once for each enemy ahead. Probably coincidence.
Bees avoid you today. Entirely. Even when you walk through their territory.
A moth lands on your map and sits on exactly the location you need to visit.
A squirrel drops an acorn on the head of someone about to lie to you.
An owl swoops past and clips the hat off someone who was following you.
Fish jump in a river, revealing the shallowest crossing point.
A lizard basks on a warm rock and scurries away in the exact direction you should go.
Birds go silent as you approach a clearing. The silence itself is the warning.
A turtle blocks a doorway just long enough for you to notice something above it.
A colony of ants has formed a trail that perfectly outlines a hidden trapdoor.
Crows gather on a rooftop and caw at a specific window. Something important is there.
A deer stands in a moonbeam and stares at you. When it moves, there's a path behind it.
A bee pollinates a flower next to you. The pollen has mild restorative properties.
A rabbit darts across your path, startling an enemy who loses their footing.
Moths gather around you instead of the nearest flame. They're surprisingly warm.
The inn's special today is exactly what you've been craving.
A cook at a roadside stall accidentally makes your portion twice as large.
Your waterskin refills slightly more than it should from the last stream.
Someone left a perfectly good wedge of cheese in the room you're searching.
The ale at this tavern is the best you've ever tasted. You feel genuinely renewed.
Trail rations you forgot about turn out to be perfectly preserved and quite tasty.
A fruit tree grows improbably close to where you set up camp.
The bread you bought yesterday is somehow still warm.
Tea from a roadside vendor clears your sinuses and sharpens your mind.
A hunter shares fresh game with your party. More than enough for everyone.
Wild herbs grow within arm's reach of your campsite. Perfect for seasoning.
The well water here tastes faintly of honey. Everyone feels better after drinking it.
A fisherman's catch is so abundant he gives half away. You're first in line.
Your morning coffee is exactly the right temperature for once.
Someone left a pie cooling on a windowsill. A note says 'for travelers.'
The mushrooms growing near camp are not only safe but delicious.
Your preserved food tastes better than when it was fresh. Alchemical accident, probably.
A vineyard owner offers a taste of their private reserve. It's extraordinary.
The soup at this roadside inn has a secret ingredient. It's love. And pepper.
You discover a natural spring that tastes faintly of mint.
A guard remembers you from somewhere pleasant and waves you through.
The next person you argue with concedes a point unexpectedly.
A child tugs your sleeve and points at something everyone else missed.
Two NPCs who were arguing fall silent when you arrive. Both want your opinion.
A shopkeeper accidentally quotes you the wholesale price.
The town drunk turns out to have once been someone very important. They remember a useful detail.
A rival grudgingly admits you were right about something.
The person you need to talk to is in an unusually forgiving mood.
A noble drops a glove. Returning it earns you a small but genuine favor.
The clerk at the government office is actually efficient today.
A messenger mistakes you for someone important. The deference opens a door.
Two merchants are in a bidding war for your business. Prices drop.
A storyteller in a tavern tells a tale that contains a coded message. For you specifically? Unclear.
A priest offers a blessing without being asked. It feels different from the usual ones.
The guild master's secretary likes you for no discernible reason. Your paperwork moves faster.
A bouncer at a club recognizes your name and lets you skip the line.
A pickpocket targets you but finds nothing and leaves a coin as an apology.
The landlord forgets to charge you for the extra night.
A retired soldier shares a tactical insight over drinks. It's genuinely useful.
A painter asks to sketch your portrait. The result is flattering and slightly magical.
The harbormaster owes someone who looks exactly like you a favor. Close enough.
A diplomat you once helped sends you a letter of introduction to someone powerful.
The next person who tries to intimidate you stutters.
A merchant throws in something extra because they like your face.
A beggar you give a coin to turns out to be remarkably well-connected.
The apothecary has exactly the rare ingredient you need and forgot it was in stock.
A traveling noble's carriage throws a wheel near you. Helping earns a standing invitation to dinner.
A scribe makes a copying error in your favor.
The judge is in a lenient mood today.
A fence offers better rates because business is slow. Lucky timing.
Your blade finds a gap in the enemy's armor you didn't know was there.
An arrow that should have hit you clips your hair instead.
Your shield catches a blow at exactly the right angle to deflect it harmlessly.
Dust blows into your enemy's eyes at a critical moment.
The ground beneath your enemy is slightly uneven. They stumble.
Your bowstring holds despite looking frayed. One more shot.
A branch breaks under an approaching enemy, announcing their position.
Your opponent's weapon gets caught on their own cloak for a split second.
The sun comes out from behind a cloud and blinds your opponent briefly.
You accidentally kick a stone at the perfect angle to trip a charging foe.
Your backup weapon is in better condition than you remembered.
An enemy slips on blood from a wound you inflicted earlier.
Your muscle memory kicks in for a technique you thought you'd forgotten.
The wall behind you provides unexpected cover from a flanking attack.
Rain makes the enemy's grip on their weapon slightly less sure.
A chandelier is conveniently positioned above the biggest threat.
The enemy formation has an obvious weak point on the left flank.
Your armor absorbs a critical hit with a dent you can hammer out later.
A thrown object lands exactly where you aimed despite unfavorable wind.
Your footwork is inexplicably better today. You feel lighter on your feet.
A crack in the floor creates natural difficult terrain for your enemies.
The ceiling is just low enough to disadvantage the tallest opponent.
A loose flagstone tips when your enemy steps on it.
Your counterstrike catches an enemy mid-swing.
An ally's missed attack distracts the enemy enough for your hit to land.
The corridor branches and a slight breeze from the left tells you it leads outside.
A mosaic on the floor depicts the layout of the next room.
Torch sconces on the wall are spaced to suggest which path is most traveled.
Dust patterns on the floor reveal that one door is opened frequently.
A carved inscription is partially worn away, but the important words remain legible.
The echo in this chamber subtly reveals its true dimensions.
A crack in the wall lets you glimpse what's in the next room.
Old bloodstains on the floor form a pattern suggesting where not to step.
A draft from below suggests a hidden cellar or passage.
Scratch marks on a wall indicate where previous explorers found something.
The stonework here is slightly different. Recent construction. Worth investigating.
Water drips from the ceiling in a rhythm that matches your heartbeat. Oddly calming.
A skeleton in the corner clutches a note with partially legible warnings.
The floor slopes almost imperceptibly. You're going deeper than expected.
Cobwebs are thick everywhere except one corridor. Something uses it regularly.
A statue's eyes seem to follow you. But more helpfully than threateningly.
The mortar between two stones is fresher than the rest. Something was sealed here.
A mirror in an abandoned room shows a reflection that's slightly different from reality.
Mushrooms grow in a line leading toward something interesting.
The next chest you find has a false bottom with something small inside.
A painting on the wall depicts the room as it was. One detail has changed.
Sound carries strangely here. You can hear enemies two rooms away.
The air smells different near the correct path. Less stale.
A previous adventurer scratched directions into the wall with their dagger.
Ancient machinery clicks to life as you enter. It opens a shortcut.
A nearby clocktower chimes at an unusual hour. The sound reveals a resonant frequency in a wall.
A discarded gear fits perfectly into a mechanism you've been puzzling over.
A steamwork pipe bursts harmlessly but reveals a hidden compartment behind it.
A tinker's discarded prototype still has one useful function left in it.
The clockwork lock on this door is slightly misaligned. Easier to pick.
A gear-sprite has left tiny oil footprints leading to something valuable.
An automaton that should be hostile is stuck in a diagnostic loop instead.
A pneumatic tube system still works. You can send a message across the building.
A malfunctioning construct drops a valuable component before shutting down.
The pressure plate you're standing on is connected to something helpful, not harmful.
A gear mechanism in the wall slowly opens a hidden door when you press the right brick.
A defunct clockwork soldier holds a map in its frozen grip.
An alchemical lamp sputters to life near you, illuminating something hidden.
A brass telescope in an abandoned observatory still works and shows something important.
Pneumatic pistons in the floor boost your jump height in this room.
A clockwork spider emerges from a crack and repairs a broken mechanism for you.
The emergency steam release valve conveniently scalds an approaching enemy.
A gear-driven conveyor belt still operates and carries you past a hazard.
An artificer's workbench contains one usable tool you desperately needed.
The clockwork guardian's patrol pattern has a twenty-second gap. Perfect timing.
A ley line pulses beneath your feet. Your next spell feels effortless.
A ghost nods approvingly at your decisions and dissolves peacefully.
An enchanted painting whispers a compliment as you pass.
A magical residue on your hands glows faintly near hidden enchantments.
The ambient magic in this area is unusually cooperative today.
A will-o'-wisp appears, leads you past a hazard, then winks out.
Your aura resonates with a nearby magical item, revealing its location.
A cantrip you cast is slightly more effective than usual for no clear reason.
An old ward on a doorframe still has enough power to slow the next threat that crosses it.
A constellation visible tonight corresponds to a spell you've been struggling with.
Residual enchantment from a long-dead wizard makes this room slightly warmer.
A magical font still has one charge left. Just enough to be useful.
The next glyph you encounter is from a school you're proficient in.
A spectral hand emerges from a wall, points at something, and fades.
The magic circle drawn on this floor still functions, though barely.
An enchanted book falls open to the exact page you needed.
A divination you cast is slightly clearer than expected.
The arcane mark on this door matches a sigil you've seen before.
A minor blessing from a forgotten shrine still lingers in this area.
Your familiar seems unusually alert and keeps looking at a specific spot.
The next dispel check you make benefits from a harmonic resonance in the area.
An illusory wall is slightly transparent when viewed from this angle.
A ward placed centuries ago recognizes something in your bloodline and lets you pass.
The crystal in your pocket hums at a frequency that reveals nearby illusions.
A helpful imp appears, says one useful thing, and vanishes before you can ask anything else.
Fog rolls in at exactly the right moment to cover your approach.
Rain begins and washes away your tracks from the last hour.
Lightning illuminates the landscape for a split second, revealing the entire lay of the land.
A rainbow after the storm points toward your destination. Nature's waypoint.
The wind shifts to carry your scent away from the guard dogs.
Moonlight breaks through clouds at the exact moment you need to read something.
The temperature drops just enough to make your armor comfortable.
A sudden breeze dries your clothes faster than expected.
Cloud cover provides shade for the hottest part of today's march.
Snow from yesterday has melted in a pattern that reveals a buried path.
The river current is weaker than expected at this crossing point.
Autumn leaves crunch loudly under your enemy's feet but are silent under yours.
A sandstorm clears just as you reach the landmark you needed to see.
Mist in the forest creates a natural screen between you and hostile eyes.
The tide is unusually low, revealing rocks you can use as stepping stones.
Ice on a lake is thick enough to cross but thin enough to crack behind you if pursued.
A shaft of sunlight breaks through the canopy and warms exactly the spot where you rest.
The wind carries the sound of a bell from a direction you needed to travel.
Clouds form a pattern that reminds you of a map you saw recently.
The aurora tonight is beautiful. Everyone's morale improves.
You flip a coin and it lands on its edge. Take that as a sign of extraordinary luck.
A falling leaf spirals past your face and lands on a four-leaf clover.
The next gamble you take works out, but only barely.
A mirror you pass shows your reflection smiling before you do.
The number seven keeps appearing today. On doors, signs, and coin faces.
A ladder you walk under brings good luck instead. The universe overcorrected.
A black cat crosses your enemy's path.
You find a horseshoe lying open-end up. Classic lucky orientation.
The dice in your pocket feel warmer than they should.
A shooting star crosses the sky just as you make a wish you hadn't meant to.
Everything you drop today bounces once and lands exactly where you wanted it.
The slot in a vending automaton is jammed, giving you two items for the price of one.
A crack in a crystal reveals a perfect smaller crystal inside.
The lucky charm you forgot you had shifts in your pocket at an opportune moment.
Someone else's bad luck directly benefits you today.
The number on your room key matches a number you've seen twice today.
A coin you toss catches the light and distracts someone at a convenient moment.
Your horoscope for today is suspiciously specific and accurate.
A fortune cookie at a foreign restaurant contains advice clearly meant for your situation.
The one-in-a-hundred outcome happens in your favor.
A journal entry written by a previous visitor to this location answers your exact question.
Graffiti on a wall in Thieves' Cant reveals a nearby safe house.
A torn page from a bestiary describes the exact creature you're facing.
A local dialect word you overhear turns out to be the password you needed.
A map in an antique shop has your destination marked with a red circle.
The librarian finds a book they thought was lost. It's on exactly your topic.
A dream last night contained a detail you didn't notice but your subconscious did.
A nursery rhyme from your childhood turns out to be a coded set of directions.
The inscription above this door is in a language you studied but never expected to use.
An old teacher's advice suddenly makes sense in this exact context.
A wanted poster contains background information that's useful to your investigation.
A scholar you meet is writing a paper on the exact topic you need expertise in.
The heraldry on a shield tells you more than the person carrying it intended.
A children's game played in this region mirrors the puzzle you're trying to solve.
The tattoo on a stranger's arm is a map. They don't seem to know it.
A footnote in a mundane text references something directly relevant to your quest.
Dust on a shelf reveals that one book has been consulted recently. It's the right one.
A street name translates to something that hints at what's hidden beneath it.
A merchant's inventory list, discarded in the trash, contains valuable intelligence.
The artist's signature on a painting is actually a cipher.
Your rope is three feet longer than you measured. Just enough.
A dagger in your belt loop catches on something, preventing you from falling.
Your lantern flares brightly just as something lunges from the darkness.
The whetstone you borrowed sharpens your blade better than your own.
Your grappling hook catches on the first throw.
A piece of chalk in your pocket is exactly what this puzzle required.
Your shield strap, which you thought was fraying, holds firm under a heavy blow.
The glass vial you were carrying didn't break despite the fall. Tough glass.
Your lockpick set has a tool you don't remember adding. It's the right one.
A rope bridge holds your weight despite looking ready to collapse.
The ladder leaning against this wall reaches exactly to the window you need.
Your backup torch was stored better than you thought. Lights immediately.
A mirror in your pack reflects light at exactly the angle needed to signal your allies.
Your ink doesn't run despite the rain. Lucky formulation.
The net you threw tangles the enemy more thoroughly than expected.
Your crowbar fits this gap perfectly.
A compass needle spins wildly, then points confidently in one direction.
Your tent poles fit together unusually smoothly tonight.
The chain in your pack has one more link than you counted. Exactly what you needed.
Your climbing pitons are in better condition than expected.
A shortcut through an alley saves you twenty minutes.
The building you're looking for has a distinctive smell that leads you right to it.
A rooftop provides an unexpected vantage point over the entire district.
The sewer grate you need to enter is already open. Someone passed through recently.
A monument in the town square contains a hidden compartment at its base.
A market stall's awning provides perfect cover from both rain and prying eyes.
The apartment above the shop you're visiting has a fire escape leading to the next street.
A fountain in the plaza has coins at the bottom. One of them isn't a coin.
The clocktower's mechanism room is unlocked. The view from the top is strategically useful.
A cobblestone street has a loose stone that reveals a crawlspace beneath.
An underground fighting ring has information you need. The bouncer lets you watch for free.
A newspaper blowing in the wind wraps around your leg. The headline is relevant.
A bridge over the canal has a maintenance hatch that leads somewhere unexpected.
The abandoned theater has excellent acoustics. You can hear whispered conversations a floor away.
A rain barrel at the corner of a building provides just enough water to fill your waterskin.
The gargoyle on this building looks like it's pointing at something across the street.
A busker's song contains a coded message from an old network of informants.
The pharmacy's back door is visible from an angle nobody else has noticed.
A cat cafe near the market is a front for something. The cats are lovely though.
The postal service here is remarkably efficient. Your message arrives same day.
Fair winds and following seas. Travel takes half a day less than expected.
The ship's navigator discovers a shorter route that avoids the storm.
A dolphin pod escorts your vessel through dangerous waters.
Barnacles on the hull create just enough drag to slow the ship before hitting the rocks.
The crow's nest offers a view of something interesting on the horizon.
A merchant ship hails you with an offer to trade at favorable rates.
The anchor catches on something on the seabed. Hauling it up reveals a waterproof case.
A lighthouse you didn't expect to see guides you past a shoal.
The tide carries your ship into port without any rowing needed.
A sailor's knot you tied holds against winds that should have ripped it free.
A map painted on the underside of a tavern table shows a sea route nobody else knows.
The port authority is short-staffed. Your cargo goes uninspected.
A seasoned captain shares a warning about the waters ahead. It saves your ship.
The stars tonight are unusually clear. Perfect for celestial navigation.
A seagull lands on your mast and stays. Sailors say that's extremely lucky.
You dream of a door. When you wake up, you realize you've seen it before. Nearby.
Your nightmares are replaced by a vision of something beautiful. You wake refreshed.
The guard dog that should have barked at you falls asleep seconds before you arrive.
Moonlight through your window illuminates writing on the wall that's invisible by day.
You sleep so well that a minor injury has healed slightly by morning.
The inn's beds are far more comfortable than the price suggested.
A nocturnal animal makes noise that wakes you just before something bad happens.
Your internal clock wakes you at exactly the right moment.
The night is unusually quiet. Perfect for hearing approaching threats.
A dream about your childhood home contains a detail you'd forgotten that's now relevant.
Sleeping outdoors, you wake to find dew has collected perfectly in your cup.
The constellation above you forms the shape of a key. You sketch it before it moves.
An animal keeps watch while you sleep. Nothing disturbs your rest.
Your midnight snack reveals that the cheese is wrapped in a map.
The shadows in your room form shapes that remind you of the puzzle's solution.
A temple bell rings as you pass. A sense of calm settles over you.
A cleric blesses your weapon absentmindedly. It feels different in your hand.
Holy water sprinkled on a threshold sizzles slightly. Now you know.
A prayer you mutter under your breath is answered with suspicious specificity.
A shrine to a forgotten god still has offerings from this morning. Someone remembers.
Incense in a temple triggers a memory that solves a problem you'd given up on.
A religious text falls open to a page about your exact situation.
A monk's meditation technique, demonstrated briefly, helps you focus.
The aura around a temple extends just far enough to protect your campsite.
A funeral procession passes and the mourners unknowingly block your pursuers.
A confessional has thin walls. You overhear something useful.
A relic in a display case resonates as you walk past. The curator notices.
Holy ground makes the undead uncomfortable. The cemetery gate is suddenly appealing.
A saint's feast day means free food at the temple. And the abbot is talkative.
The blessing feels routine, but later it deflects something it shouldn't have been able to.
Animal tracks lead to a water source you wouldn't have found otherwise.
The cave entrance is exactly large enough for your party but too small for what's chasing you.
Edible berries grow along the path. Enough for everyone.
A natural hot spring near your campsite eases everyone's sore muscles.
The rock formation provides natural shelter from the oncoming storm.
A game trail intersects with your path and leads in a more efficient direction.
Deadfall provides enough dry wood for a fire despite the recent rain.
A cliff face has natural hand and footholds in a convenient pattern.
The forest canopy is thick enough here to keep the rain off your campsite.
A creek crossing has stepping stones placed too perfectly to be natural.
The wind carries the scent of smoke from a settlement you didn't know was nearby.
A bird's nest in a hollow tree contains something shiny that isn't an egg.
The undergrowth thins just enough for you to spot the path through.
A hollowed log makes a surprisingly comfortable emergency shelter.
Resin from a nearby tree makes an excellent waterproof seal for your pack.
The soil here is soft enough to set tent stakes but firm enough to sleep on.
A ridge provides a panoramic view of the surrounding area. You spot three landmarks.
The quicksand makes a distinct squelching sound before you step in it.
A vine hanging from a cliff is stronger than it looks and perfectly positioned.
The wild herbs growing here include one your healer recognizes as rare and valuable.
Your belt buckle catches the light and temporarily blinds an insect that was about to bite you.
A leaf lands on your head in the shape of an arrow pointing forward.
Your sneeze echoes in a way that reveals a hollow space behind the wall.
A cloud passes over the sun at the exact moment you need a shadow to hide in.
Your humming attracts a small animal that's carrying something useful in its mouth.
A crack in the ice is shaped like a rune you recognize.
Your boot scuffs reveal a different-colored stone. It's a pressure plate. You noticed in time.
Dust you kicked up reveals an invisible tripwire.
A cobweb you walk through isn't sticky. Something already cleared the spider out.
Your stomach growls loudly enough to cover the sound of a creaking door.
A button pops off your coat and rolls to a stop at a hidden switch.
The graffiti here includes coordinates. Written by someone in a hurry.
Your hat blows off in the wind and lands on a trap trigger, setting it off safely.
A puddle reflects something on the ceiling you wouldn't have seen otherwise.
Your sneeze startles a rat that was about to chew through your rope.
A merchant's parrot repeats the last thing its owner said in private. Interesting.
You step on a creaky board that sounds different from the others. It's hollow.
Your pocket lint ignites surprisingly well in an emergency.
A yawn at the right moment makes a suspicious NPC think you're bored, not nervous.
The statue's arm broke off years ago and left a perfect handhold.
A spiderweb between two trees is arranged in a pattern matching the trap mechanism inside.
Your worn-out shoe sole picks up a clay impression of a key that was lying on the floor.
A painting hung crooked on the wall hides a wall safe.
The squeaky wheel on a cart provides a constant noise that masks your footsteps.
Your reflection in a shop window shows someone behind you reaching for your purse. You turn in time.
A sneeze from the next room tells you someone is hiding there.
The cat that knocked over the vase created the perfect distraction.
Mud on your boots dries into a surprisingly effective grip surface.
A feather lands on your shoulder. The quill end is sharp enough to pick a simple lock.
Your pocket contains a crumpled receipt from a shop you don't remember visiting. The address is useful.
The figurehead on the ship seems to lean toward the correct heading.
Barnacles on a dock piling form a pattern that matches a treasure map.
A message in a bottle washes up at your feet. The contents are recent and relevant.
The harbor's signal flags spell out a warning that nobody else has noticed.
An old ship's wheel turns on its own to point north. Just once.
Rum that should have gone bad is actually better than when it was bottled.
A plank on the dock bends but doesn't break, catapulting a helpful item toward you.
Sea spray hits your face and washes away a disguise someone was wearing near you.
A ship in the harbor is flying false colors. You recognize the real flag beneath.
The tide deposits something at the waterline that was meant to stay hidden.
A crystal vein in the wall illuminates the passage ahead.
The mine cart track still works. It's faster than walking.
A collapsed tunnel has left just enough space to crawl through.
Gas in the mine makes your torch flicker, warning you before it becomes dangerous.
Pick marks on the wall suggest someone found something here and stopped digging.
An underground stream flows in the direction you need to go.
A stalactite drips water that's surprisingly clean and drinkable.
The echo pattern changes, suggesting a large chamber ahead.
Mineral deposits in the rock glow faintly, providing just enough light to see by.
A carved symbol at a junction points the way to the exit.
A memory of someone you love gives you strength at a critical moment.
A song from your homeland plays in your head. You feel centered.
Your determination inspires an ally to push through their own fatigue.
A child's laughter from somewhere nearby reminds you what you're fighting for.
The sunset tonight is the most beautiful you've ever seen. Morale soars.
A letter from home arrives unexpectedly. The timing is perfect.
You recall a mentor's words at exactly the moment they apply.
Anger at an enemy sharpens your focus instead of clouding it.
A shared joke between party members turns a tense moment into a bonding one.
You catch your reflection and realize you look like someone capable and strong.
The forge is at the perfect temperature when you arrive.
A rare material you need costs half what you expected.
Your stitching holds under stress that should have ripped it apart.
An artisan notices your work and offers a tip that improves your technique.
The glue sets faster than expected. Whatever you repaired is actually stronger now.
A smithy has a spare tool they lend you at no charge.
Your carving reveals a grain pattern in the wood that makes it naturally stronger.
A tailor adjusts your garment for free because they enjoy the challenge.
The dye takes on a richer color than expected. Someone will pay extra for this.
A potter's wheel is available when every other workshop is busy.
A pigeon delivers a strongly worded letter to someone who just annoyed you. Not from you. Just... karma.
Your dramatic entrance is perfectly timed with a crack of thunder. Pure coincidence.
An enemy trips over their own impressive cape.
A door you kicked open dramatically stays open instead of swinging back into your face.
Your witty retort lands perfectly. Even your enemies pause to appreciate it.
A wanted poster of you is actually quite flattering.
An NPC you just met tells a joke that's actually funny. It's been a long time.
Your heroic pose on the hilltop is witnessed by exactly the right people.
A bard writes a song about you. It's not terrible.
Your catchphrase gets repeated by a child in the street. Fame has arrived.
An enemy monologues long enough for you to finish your plan.
Your horse does something unexpectedly cool. You take full credit.
A dramatic wind blows your hair at the perfect moment.
Your battle cry echoes impressively off the canyon walls.
A bird lands on your outstretched sword arm. It looks very heroic.
A cipher you've been struggling with suddenly clicks into place.
A disguise you threw together works far better than it should.
An alibi you forgot you had is corroborated by an unexpected witness.
A forged document passes inspection because the guard is looking at the wrong section.
A dead drop contains more than what was promised.
Your cover story is accidentally verified by an unrelated event.
A double agent reveals themselves by reacting to a name they shouldn't know.
A locked drawer in a desk has a false back that's easier to open than the lock.
The wax seal on a letter was pressed with a ring you've seen before.
A mirror in the suspect's room reveals fingerprints that shouldn't be there.
Your interrogation subject is more afraid of silence than questions. You wait.
A hidden message in a painting is visible only in candlelight.
The suspect's alibi has a gap they didn't realize. Your timeline reveals it.
A servant who 'saw nothing' makes eye contact a beat too long.
The escape route your quarry uses has a squeaky hinge they forgot about.
You arrive exactly five minutes before the opportunity closes.
The thing you've been waiting for happens today.
A delay that frustrated you turns out to have kept you safe.
The patience you showed earlier earns you unexpected respect.
Something you planted weeks ago has finally grown into something useful.
A connection you made casually pays off in a way you didn't expect.
The slow route turns out to be the safe route.
Time you spent studying pays off in a single, decisive moment.
An investment you'd forgotten about matures at exactly the right time.
The person you need arrives at the same place you are, entirely by coincidence.
A wound that looked bad turns out to be shallow.
Your healer's hands are steadier than usual today.
A medicinal herb growing wild is exactly the one you need.
The bandage holds better than expected through the rest of the fight.
Rest comes easily tonight. Your body recovers faster than usual.
A hot spring nearby has minor restorative properties.
The local healer has an experimental treatment. It works.
A poultice made from available ingredients is surprisingly effective.
Your immune system fights off an infection that should have been much worse.
A kind stranger offers you a salve. It smells terrible but works wonders.
A Pathfinder wayfinder reacts to something nearby. Yours, or someone else's.
A Varisian fortune teller gives you a free reading. It's oddly specific.
A Shoanti wind-caller nods at you. The wind shifts in your favor.
A Keleshite merchant recognizes craftsmanship in your gear and offers a trade.
A dwarven rune carved into a doorframe flickers when you touch it. Protective ward. Still active.
An elven archer watches you from a treeline and raises a hand in greeting. Then vanishes.
A gnomish tinker offers to wind your clockwork item for free. It runs smoother afterward.
A halfling cook feeds your entire party and refuses payment. Hospitality of the road.
A Thassilonian inscription you shouldn't be able to read makes sudden, partial sense.
A Chelish bureaucrat stamps your document with the wrong seal. The wrong seal is better.
An Andoren eagle screams overhead. Your resolve hardens.
A Taldan noble recognizes your family name. You didn't realize it carried weight here.
A Qadiran perfumer gives you a sample. It masks your scent from predators.
An Osirian archaeologist shares a detail about the ruins ahead.
A Mwangi guide appears at a crossroads and points. Then walks the other way.
A Linnorm King's cairn marker warns of danger ahead. The warning is current.
An Ulfen skald sings a battle hymn. Your grip on your weapon tightens with purpose.
A Vudrani monk pauses in meditation to tell you your stance is wrong. The correction helps.
A Tian merchant's puzzle box has one solution you recognize from another continent.
A Razatlani artifact pulses when you touch it. Just once. Acknowledging you.
A shadow falls across you at just the right moment. Nobody sees you move.
The floorboard that should have creaked was recently oiled. By whom?
A cat knocks something off a shelf in the next room, covering the sound of your entry.
Your dark clothing blends perfectly with the wall behind you.
A servant's uniform left on a hook fits you exactly.
The patrol changes shift earlier than scheduled. The gap widens.
A convenient stack of crates provides cover where there was none.
Your footprints in the dust are obscured by a draft from a window.
The lock you need to pick is a model you've practiced on hundreds of times.
A conversation in the next room grows heated, masking your movements.
The ventilation shaft is wider than the blueprints suggested.
A dog that should have barked at you whimpers and lies down instead.
The ceiling has decorative molding thick enough to support your weight.
Someone left a window unlatched. Not the one you expected, but a better one.
A merchant's cart passes between you and the guard at exactly the right moment.
The guard's torch gutters in the wind, creating a blind spot.
A drunk stumbles into the guard post, buying you thirty seconds.
Your escape rope is the same color as the building's stonework.
A laundry line provides a clothed crossing between rooftops.
The attic access panel is hidden behind a tapestry that swings easily.
The tripwire is a different color than the floor. Barely, but enough.
A poisoned needle in a lock is coated unevenly. You spot the residue.
The pit trap's covering sags slightly in the center.
Dust motes swirl around an invisible force field, outlining its shape.
The mechanism for the blade trap is visible from below through a grate.
A pressure plate is slightly raised compared to the surrounding stones.
The gas nozzle is clogged. The trap triggers but nothing comes out.
A mirror positioned at an angle reveals the dart holes in the corridor.
The water on the floor isn't just a puddle. It outlines the safe path.
Scorch marks on the walls tell you exactly where the fire trap's range ends.
A previous victim's skeleton is positioned in a way that reveals the trap's trigger.
The ceiling trap's counterweight is rusted. It descends slowly enough to dodge.
A dead insect on the floor marks the boundary of a magical sensor.
The acid trap's reservoir is nearly empty. What comes out barely stings.
A grinding sound precedes the crushing walls by a full three seconds.
A margin note in an old text was written by someone who visited where you're going.
The index of an ancient library includes a reference you've never seen catalogued.
A water stain on a map page reveals hidden ink beneath.
The binding of a book conceals a thin blade. Useful in an emergency.
A coded message in a history book matches a cipher you learned years ago.
The bestiary's illustration includes a detail about the creature's weakness.
A prayer book contains a pressed flower with mild alchemical properties.
The atlas shows a road that newer maps have forgotten.
A diary's last entry ends mid-sentence. The ink matches a pen in the next room.
The ledger has an entry crossed out. The original is still legible underneath.
A children's primer in a dead language helps you decode an inscription.
Footnotes in a scholarly text contain gossip that turns out to be intelligence.
A cookbook from this region includes a recipe that doubles as an alchemical formula.
The family bible has birth records going back centuries. One name stands out.
A ship's log records coordinates that don't match any known landmark. Until now.
A bell tower's chime resonates with a hidden mechanism, opening a passage.
Humming a particular tune calms the agitated creature blocking your path.
The acoustics of this room make whispers carry to a specific spot. Useful.
A street musician's melody matches the tonal lock on the vault door.
Wind through the ruins creates a whistling that varies by corridor. Follow the lowest pitch.
An echo returns faster than expected. The room is smaller than it looks.
A bard's lute has a loose string that vibrates near hidden enchantments.
The rhythm of machinery in the walls follows a pattern. A gap means a door.
Birdsong outside changes when strangers approach. Natural alarm system.
A crystal goblet rings at a frequency that cracks the glass covering a keyhole.
The pipe organ in the abandoned church still has air pressure. One note opens a passage.
Raindrops on a metal roof create a rhythm that matches the combination lock.
A tuning fork found in a drawer resonates with something behind the wall.
The sound of running water masks your conversation from eavesdroppers.
Drumming from a distant camp gives you a count of how many people are there.
A trained falcon returns to you despite belonging to someone else. It carries a useful message.
A mule refuses to cross a bridge. You inspect and find the supports are rotted through.
Pack animals are unusually calm today. Travel is smooth.
A war dog that belongs to the enemy is more interested in the jerky in your pocket.
Carrier pigeons at a roost include one that will fly to your destination.
A cat in a wizard's tower sits on a specific book. The wizard says it only does that for important ones.
A swarm of bats exits a cave entrance, revealing its location in the cliff face.
Your horse stamps twice. There's a snake exactly where you were about to step.
A hunting falcon spots your quarry from the air and circles above them.
A friendly dog at the inn guards your room door all night. Nobody enters.
A rat in the dungeon follows a specific path through the corridors. It knows the safe route.
A bear in the wilderness ignores you entirely. It's eaten recently. Lucky timing.
An ox at a farm responds to your voice commands. The farmer is impressed.
Seabirds dive at a specific spot in the water. Something is just below the surface.
A parrot at the docks repeats a phrase from last night's secret meeting.
The keystone of an arch is loose. Push it and a hidden door opens.
A spiral staircase has one step that's a different height. It's a trigger for something.
The chimney is wide enough to climb and leads to an unguarded room.
A stained glass window casts colored light that reveals invisible writing on the floor.
The building's foundation has a drainage tunnel large enough to enter.
A decorative column is hollow. Something clinks inside it.
The rooftop has a perfect line of sight to your objective.
A balcony connects two buildings that look separate from street level.
The tile pattern on the floor is a map of the building when viewed from above.
A beam in the ceiling is carved with distance markers. Someone measured this room precisely.
The garden wall has a gate hidden behind climbing roses.
A dumbwaiter in the kitchen still operates and reaches the third floor.
The servant's quarters have a back staircase that bypasses the guarded main hall.
A bricked-up window was done hastily. The mortar crumbles with minimal force.
The building's acoustics carry sound from the basement to the attic. Someone designed this on purpose.
A coin purse dropped in the market contains exactly the denomination you needed.
A gem you thought was glass turns out to be genuine. Low quality, but real.
The treasure chest's false bottom is poorly constructed. You find it immediately.
A silver coin in your pocket tarnishes near poison. Useful detection method.
The bounty for the creature you just killed is higher than the posting said.
An antique dealer identifies something in your pack as worth twice what you paid.
A debt you're owed is repaid unexpectedly and with interest.
The exchange rate today is unusually favorable.
A vein of precious metal runs through the wall of the cave you're sheltering in.
Loose change in a fountain includes a coin from a kingdom that no longer exists. Collectors pay well.
A gemstone you bartered for turns out to be part of a matched set. The other half is nearby.
The pirate's hidden stash was never found because everyone looked in the wrong cave.
A tax collector made an error in your favor. They don't notice.
The reward for information is payable in advance. Unusual, but welcome.
A cache of supplies hidden by a previous party is still intact and unclaimed.
Your mount finds a path through terrain that should have been impassable.
The cart's axle holds despite the rough road. Good craftsmanship.
A ferry arrives at the crossing just as you reach the riverbank.
Your mount senses danger before you do and stops short of an ambush.
A carriage for hire appears on a road where you expected none.
The boat has a hidden compartment you discover while bailing water.
Your mount jumps a gap that should have been too wide. Barely.
A wagon train heading your direction offers to let you ride along.
The horse trader has one mount left and it's exactly your preferred breed.
Your ship catches a current that doubles your speed for two hours.
An ally you hadn't contacted shows up at exactly the right moment.
Your companion notices something you missed and points it out quietly.
A former rival offers temporary alliance. Their skills complement yours perfectly.
An animal companion bonds with a party member who needed the comfort.
Your informant network delivers a tip without being asked.
A hired guide knows a detail about the region that isn't on any map.
A mercenary company owes a favor to someone who owes you. The chain holds.
Your ally's distraction works better than planned.
A sympathizer in the enemy camp leaves a door unlocked for you.
Your scout returns with intel that changes the entire tactical picture.
A healer in the party discovers a new application for a spell they already know.
An engineer in the group immediately spots the structural weakness you all missed.
A diplomat among your allies defuses a situation that was about to turn violent.
A translator in the market recognizes the language on the artifact.
Your lookout spots the ambush with enough time for everyone to prepare.
Your bluff is so confident that even you start to believe it.
The accent you fake is close enough to fool everyone but a native. No natives are present.
A costume from a theater trunk matches the uniform of the guards perfectly.
Your forged letter uses a seal you pressed from a signet ring impression in candle wax.
The person you're impersonating hasn't been seen locally in years. Nobody remembers them clearly.
A wig in an abandoned dressing room matches the description of the person you need to become.
Your cover identity has a paper trail you didn't create. Someone else used this alias.
The checkpoint guard is new and doesn't know the faces they should be checking.
A convenient hat shadows your face at exactly the right angle.
The name you chose for your alias belongs to a real person who happens to be traveling abroad.
The card game tonight has unusually high stakes. Your hand is good.
A loaded die rolls in your favor when someone else cheats poorly.
The pit fighter you bet on wins in an upset. Nobody else saw it coming.
A board game in a tavern mirrors a tactical problem you're facing. The solution transfers.
Your poker face is exceptional tonight. Even you're not sure what you're thinking.
A drinking game reveals that your opponent can't hold their liquor or their secrets.
The horse race favorite stumbles. Your longshot places second. Still pays well.
A chess puzzle left on a table reveals the combination to a nearby lock.
The carnival game is rigged, but the rigging has a flaw you spot immediately.
A wager you made months ago comes due today. In your favor.
The blade cuts your shirt but misses your skin by a thread.
A fall that should have broken something only leaves a bruise.
The explosion's shockwave throws you behind cover instead of into the open.
An arrow embeds in your pack instead of your back. Your spare book saved you.
The ceiling collapses just behind you, not on you.
Poison splashes on your glove instead of your skin. You remove it in time.
A fall into water hurts less than hitting the ground would have.
Your helmet takes a dent that would have been your skull.
The burning building collapses inward, not outward. You were outside.
A broken bridge leaves you hanging instead of falling. You can climb up.
Today's festival means the guards are distracted and the markets are busy.
A harvest celebration fills the streets. Perfect cover for moving unseen.
The winter solstice weakens certain wards. A door that's usually sealed is passable tonight.
A merchant caravan arrives for the seasonal fair. They carry exactly what you need.
The summer heat has made the guards lazy. Shift changes take longer.
Spring floods have receded, revealing a cave entrance that's normally underwater.
The autumn leaves have fallen, and you can see through the forest to the castle.
A religious holiday closes the government offices. The building is unguarded.
The new year celebration means fireworks. The noise covers everything.
A lunar eclipse makes the night darker than usual. Perfect for your purposes.
An accidental mixture produces a compound that glows in the presence of lies.
The reagent you thought was depleted has one more use at the bottom of the vial.
A grinding stone in the workshop is already set to the grit you need.
The kiln is at temperature. No waiting needed.
An experimental alloy you created is unexpectedly resistant to corrosion.
The leather you're working is from an animal with naturally tough hide. Superior material.
A chemical reaction that should have taken hours completes in minutes.
The mold for the casting is already prepared. Someone started this project and abandoned it.
Your soldering holds under heat that should have melted it.
An alchemist's notebook left in the lab contains the formula you've been trying to derive.
A sending spell reaches its target despite the interference.
The message you left in the dead drop has been answered. Quickly.
A signal fire on a distant hill tells you allies are in position.
The coded message uses a book cipher. You have the book.
A messenger arrives with news you needed before you knew you needed it.
The speaking tube in the old building still connects two distant rooms.
A flag semaphore station is manned by someone who owes your organization a favor.
The letter arrives unsealed but unread. The courier is illiterate.
A magical message bottle floats upstream to your location.
The bird you sent carries a reply that includes information you didn't ask for but needed.
A dust devil picks up leaves and swirls them into a momentary arrow shape.
Your boots grip the ice better than anyone else's. Good cobbler.
The curtain in this room is thick enough to muffle sound. Useful for planning.
A street performer's acrobatics demonstrate that the rooftop you need to reach is accessible.
A loose thread on your cloak catches on a hidden latch, revealing a compartment.
The next storm holds off just long enough for you to finish what you're doing.
Your handwriting happens to resemble the author of the document you need to forge.
The enemy's supply line passes through a valley with only one entrance. Convenient.
A fallen tree creates a natural bridge exactly where you need to cross.
Your tent is pitched on slightly higher ground than the rest. You stay dry in the flash flood.
The local currency uses a metal that reacts to magic. Your coins hum near enchantments.
A smoke signal from an unknown source draws away the patrol that was blocking your path.
The puzzle box has a seam visible only in direct sunlight. You're outside.
A woodpecker's rhythm on a hollow tree matches Morse code for 'danger.' Coincidence. Probably.
Your belt knife is sharper today than when you last used it. Someone stropped it.
The next bridge you cross has guardrails. A small luxury you appreciate.
A chalk outline on the floor matches the shape of the key you're carrying.
Your candle burns with a blue flame in this room. The air is safe.
The lock has been picked before. The pins are already worn to the open position.
A local custom requires everyone to leave doors unlocked during the festival. Today is the festival.
Your map and the terrain finally agree. You know exactly where you are.
The wind carries the smell of cooking from an inn you didn't know was over the hill.
A scarecrow in a field is pointing at the horizon. Toward your destination.
Your reflection in a suit of armor shows the room behind you. Something moves.
The tax on goods entering the city has been temporarily suspended. You save a day's wages.
A vine growing up the castle wall has thorns everywhere except one strip. A natural ladder.
Your flint sparks on the first strike. It's going to be a good day.
A beggar offers to watch your horses. They're still there when you return, brushed and watered.
The bridge troll is asleep. Deeply asleep.
A door at the end of the hall has light seeping under it. Everywhere else is dark.
Your coin purse catches on a nail, preventing you from spending money on something you'd regret.
The alley you duck into connects to the street you needed. Shortcut discovered.
A crack in the ceiling lets in enough light to read by.
The mechanism is labeled. In Common. Someone designed this to be user-friendly.
A shopkeeper wraps your purchase in a page torn from a book. The page is interesting.
Your torch sputters and reveals a face carved in the wall you would have walked past.
The enemy drops something useful when they flee.
A friendly rivalry between two merchants means both offer you their best price.
The next knot you tie holds. Really holds. Like, better than it should.
A flagpole provides a convenient way to descend from the tower.
The sound of your footsteps changes. You've stepped onto a hollow floor.
A child's discarded toy is a perfect miniature of the building's layout.
Your pack is lighter than yesterday. Nothing is missing. The pack is just better organized.
A crack in the dam creates a trickle that leads to a flooded chamber below.
The innkeeper mentions a shortcut that saves you two days of travel.
A key you found weeks ago fits a lock you encounter today.
An earthquake settles the foundation of the building you're in. It's actually more stable now.
A scarab beetle lands on your shield. In some cultures that's a sign of divine favor.
Your next thrown weapon returns to your hand. Once. Then it stops doing that.
A jeweler's loupe left in a drawer lets you spot a flaw in the gem everyone thought was real.
The mortar in the wall hasn't fully cured. You can crumble through with effort.
A signal mirror in your pack catches light at the perfect angle to blind an enemy.
Your next roll of bandages is longer than standard. Someone packed extra.
A diplomatic pouch on the road has already been emptied but the pouch itself has a hidden compartment.
The chandelier chain is exactly long enough to swing to the balcony.
Your enemy's backup arrives late. By two rounds.
A gargoyle on the roof provides the only viable anchor point for your rope. It holds.
A feather from an unknown bird drifts past and settles on the correct book.
Your next Athletics check feels effortless. Adrenaline or luck, take your pick.
A stagecoach offers you a ride exactly when your feet are about to give out.
The necklace you looted turns out to be a key when the pendant is removed.
A mirror behind a painting reveals a one-way viewing hole from the next room.
The courier pigeon knows a route that avoids the checkpoints.
Your next Medicine check benefits from unusually clean working conditions.
A stable hand warns you about a lame horse the dealer is trying to sell.
The next social event you attend has an open bar. Tongues loosen.
A minor tremor shifts a bookcase and reveals a wall safe you wouldn't have found otherwise.
A patch of wildflowers marks a buried cache. Someone planted them as a marker.
Your climbing rope has a knot pattern that matches the frequency of handholds on this wall.
The dye on a map wasn't fully waterproof. Getting it wet reveals hidden annotations.
A minstrel's ballad about a local lord contains clues to his secret passages.
The prison guard's keys jingle in a specific pattern. You memorize which key is which.
An old well has handholds carved into the interior. Someone used this as an escape route.
Your next Intimidation check is helped by a sudden gust that makes your cloak billow dramatically.
A book on herbalism includes a recipe that's actually an antidote for the poison you encountered.
The tavern's back room is available. It has a door that locks from the inside.
A cloud of bats exits the cave, and the last one drops a pellet that contains a small ring.
Your next Nature check is aided by a local plant you recognize from home.
A gust of wind reveals footprints in the sand that were about to be covered.
The fire spreads in the opposite direction from you. The wind is on your side.
Your next Stealth check is assisted by the sound of a thunderclap overhead.
A loose brick in the chimney hides a small pouch of gems. The previous owner forgot them.
A compass rose carved in the floor is actually calibrated. True north is where it says.
The merchant's scale is off by a hair. In your favor this time.
A passing wagon splashes mud on the person who was about to identify you.
Your next rest is interrupted only by a pleasant dream about flying.
A sentry falls asleep three minutes into their shift. You have a window.
A water barrel in the courtyard provides both cover and a source of drinking water.
The rug in this room is positioned to hide a trapdoor. You check under rugs now.
A street vendor's cart blocks the alley your pursuer needs to use.
The wax seal on your letter is a perfect forgery. Even the recipient's secretary is fooled.
A crack in the enemy's shield widens with your next hit.
The town crier announces news that corroborates your cover story.
A lost dog you returned to its owner belongs to someone useful.
The bounty hunter after your target shares your target's location for a split of the reward.
A dust storm provides perfect cover for your approach to the fortress.
Your next trap-setting attempt benefits from unusually cooperative terrain.
The bridge toll is waived for parties of your size. New policy.
An acoustic quirk in the throne room means you can whisper to an ally across the hall.
A cartographer's error on a common map leads everyone else astray. You have the corrected version.
The servant's entrance is unguarded because the steward is at lunch.
Your next Survival check is trivial. Someone left clear trail markers.
A magic shop has a clearance sale. The items are minor but legitimate.
A grapevine near the window is strong enough to climb and reaches the second floor.
The crystal ball in the abandoned wizard's tower still has one charge. You see something useful.
An escaped laboratory specimen blocks a corridor you needed blocked.
Your reputation precedes you into this town. For once, that's helpful.
A riveted joint in a suit of armor you're examining reveals it was modified for a hidden weapon.
The landlord's cat sits on the one loose floorboard. You check under it after the cat leaves.
An unsent letter in a desk drawer contains the password to the vault.
Your next Acrobatics check is boosted by surfaces that are less slippery than they look.
A scribe's blotted inkwell leaves a mark that matches the missing piece of a torn document.
The underground river has a current that flows toward your destination.
A minor cave-in blocks the route behind you, but also blocks anyone following.
The alchemist's mistake produces a compound that's actually more useful than what they intended.
A stray arrow from a distant battle embeds in a tree near you, carrying a message on its shaft.
Your next Society check benefits from a detail you overheard last week.
An abandoned minecart provides fast, if uncontrolled, transportation deeper underground.
A spider's web across a doorway is undisturbed. Nobody has entered this room recently. It's safe.
The password is scratched into the underside of the desk. Previous visitor was forgetful.
A natural chimney in the cave provides ventilation and a climbing route.
Your rations include hardtack that's honestly pretty good. The army surplus has improved.
A musician's instrument case is exactly the right size to smuggle what you need.
The fog lifts for precisely long enough to get your bearings, then descends again.
A retired treasure hunter's pub stories contain one detail that's actually true.
Your next Deception check is assisted by a nearby commotion that distracts your target.
The roof tiles here are close enough to jump between. Someone designed this neighborhood for it.
A mechanical failure in the drawbridge mechanism keeps it lowered for an extra hour.
Your rope has exactly three more feet than you estimated. That's the margin you needed.
A colony of luminescent fungi illuminates the cave passage well enough to navigate without a torch.
The enemy's war horn fails to sound. A bird nested in it.
A ledger in the harbormaster's office was left open. Today's cargo manifests are visible.
The statue you're hiding behind is in the one blind spot of the room's surveillance.
An overgrown garden path leads to a door everyone else has forgotten.
Your next Diplomacy check starts well because your counterpart just received good news.
A merchant caravan's abandoned campfire is still warm. The embers save you twenty minutes.
The ice on the lake has a natural thin spot in the shape of a circle. It's an old fishing hole.
A rope bridge sways but holds. The view from the middle is worth the vertigo.
Your next Thievery check benefits from tools that are better maintained than you remembered.
A guard you bribed last month remembers the favor and returns it unprompted.
The next cipher you encounter uses a system your mentor taught you.
A helpful sprite has cleaned your equipment overnight. Everything sparkles.
Your next ranged attack catches an updraft that extends its range by just enough.
A broken window provides both entry and ventilation in a room that was becoming dangerously stuffy.
The local dialect includes a word that has no translation but perfectly describes your situation.
A cloud of steam from a vent obscures you from view at a critical moment.
Your next Will save is bolstered by a memory of someone who believed in you.
A mosaic on the temple floor includes a date. That date is tomorrow.
The market closes early today, trapping your target inside with fewer witnesses.
A pothole in the road jolts the cart and dislodges a panel, revealing hidden cargo.
Your campfire smoke rises straight up. No wind tonight. Peaceful.
A tethered boat has just enough slack in its rope to reach the other side.
The old watchtower's stairs are intact. The view from the top changes everything.
A courier's horse throws a shoe in front of you. In gratitude for helping, they share news from ahead.
The river bends here, creating a still pool perfect for refilling waterskins.
A shed behind the inn contains tools that aren't locked up. The innkeeper shrugs when you ask.
Your next Craft check benefits from materials that are higher quality than what you paid for.
A passing merchant recognizes the symbol on your gear and offers insider pricing.
The floor plan of this building matches one you've been in before. You know where the exits are.
A gust extinguishes the enemy's torch. You can still see. They can't.
The hay in the stable loft is deep enough to break a fall from the window above.
Your belt pouch has a false bottom you forgot about. Something useful is inside.
A theatrical smoke bomb rolls across the stage during a performance. Perfect cover for your exit.
The cipher key is printed on the back of a playing card in the deck on the table.
A dog in the street barks three times, then stops. Three guards approach. You were warned.
Your next Performance check benefits from acoustics so good they make anyone sound talented.
A loose nail in the dock planking hooks your pursuer's boot. You gain ten seconds.
The sundial in the courtyard has been modified. Its shadow points at a hidden niche at noon.
A forgotten garden behind the estate has grown over the walls. Natural concealment.
Your next check to Recall Knowledge benefits from a pamphlet you picked up and forgot about.
The drawbridge chains have a maintenance platform halfway up. Perfect resting point during the climb.
An out-of-business tavern still has its cellar stocked. The ale has aged remarkably well.
A weather vane spins and points at you. Then at a building. Then stops.
The embassy's schedule means the ambassador is out. The junior staff are less suspicious.
Your next Reflex save is helped by boots with unexpectedly good traction.
A beekeeper's smoke calms the giant wasps in the next room just enough.
The next challenge you face has been faced by someone who left detailed notes.
A clay tablet breaks when you drop it, but the pieces reassemble into a different message.
Your shadow is darker than it should be in this light. It's protecting you from something.
A wind chime's melody changes when someone with hostile intent approaches.
Your next Perception check reveals something hidden in plain sight.
The vault's combination is the date carved above the entrance. Nobody thought to check.
A helpful stranger turns out to be exactly as helpful as they seemed. No catch.
A clockwork owl on a rooftop hoots twice. Two exits from this building. Good to know.
Your scabbard has developed a slight curve that makes your draw faster.
A merchant's daughter recognizes you from a story. The story is better than what actually happened.
The warden's logbook includes a floor plan sketched in the margins.
A perfectly timed sneeze from someone else breaks the tension in the room. Negotiations resume.
